headline: Dogfooding Our Own SaaS Product Got Us Our First 20 Customers
description:
We at Proxies API have clients who have used our Rotating Proxies Service for all sorts of web crawling use cases.

Since we are a Rotating Proxy Service that developers use to scale their web crawling, our ideal audience is developers. So we are always on the lookout for opportunities to help developers—especially developers who are involved in web scraping web crawling projects.

So we need to know when someone asks a question about anything to do with Web crawling/Web Scraping or Data Mining technologies.

So we have built our little web crawler behind the scenes to Quora and other social networks like Twitter, Facebook, Linkedin, Google News for people needing help with these technologies.

Since we started doing this, this is one of our primary drivers of traffic, which happened by merely finding and answering questions online about these topics on time.

Since we started this internal crawler, we have detected about 500 places across Quora, Linkedin, Facebook, Twitter, Reddit, etc. where we can add value.

Our bot returns a database of these opportunities like below for us daily, and its fun to watch everyone on the team try to take a crack at answering/helping them.

It has prompted many interesting discussions and knowledge sharing and research sessions amongst the team.

We have already posted about 110 answers in various places in a systematic way. Sometimes, these questions inspire an in-depth blog post on our blog as well. We even got some people from Quora who directly reached out and became our customers, plus we are helping them set up their entire crawling infrastructure!

We also feel like we have a pulse on the pain points that our potential customers face and have grown to have real empathy for them by just actively looking to help in any way we can.

The author is the founder of Proxies API (https://www.proxiesapi.com/), a proxy rotation api service.)the rotating proxies service.

This article originally appeared here:https://www.proxiesapi.com/blog/how-dog-fooding-our-own-saas-product-got-us-our-fi.html.php
headline_zh-Hans: 为我们自己的SaaS产品提供狗粮，使我们获得了前20个客户
headline_zh-Hant: 為我們自己的SaaS產品提供狗糧，使我們獲得了前20個客戶
description_zh-Hans:
我们Proxies API的客户将我们的旋转代理服务用于各种网络抓取用例。

由于我们是一个旋转代理服务，开发人员使用它来扩展他们的网络抓取，我们的理想受众是开发人员。因此，我们一直在寻找机会来帮助开发人员--特别是参与网络抓取网络抓取项目的开发人员。

因此，当有人提出与网络抓取/网络抓取或数据挖掘技术有关的任何问题时，我们需要知道。

因此，我们在幕后建立了我们的小网络爬虫，以Quora和其他社交网络，如Twitter、Facebook、Linkedin、Google News，为需要帮助的人提供这些技术。

自从我们开始这样做以来，这是我们流量的主要驱动力之一，这只是通过及时发现和回答网上关于这些主题的问题而发生的。

自从我们开始这个内部爬虫，我们已经在Quora、Linkedin、Facebook、Twitter、Reddit等地方检测到了大约500个我们可以增加价值的地方。

我们的机器人每天为我们返回一个类似下面这些机会的数据库，看着团队中的每个人都试图去回答/帮助他们，这很有趣。

这在团队中引发了许多有趣的讨论和知识分享以及研究会议。

我们已经在不同的地方以系统的方式发布了大约110个答案。有时，这些问题也会在我们的博客上激发出一篇深入的博文。我们甚至得到了一些来自Quora的人，他们直接联系并成为我们的客户，另外我们还在帮助他们建立整个抓取基础设施！

我们也觉得我们掌握了潜在客户所面临的痛点的脉搏，并且通过积极寻求任何方式的帮助，我们已经逐渐对他们产生了真正的共鸣。

作者是Proxies API（https://www.proxiesapi.com/）的创始人，这是一项代理轮换api服务。

本文最初出现在：https://www.proxiesapi.com/blog/how-dog-fooding-our-own-saas-product-got-us-our-fi.html.php
